'Villanova University' is a private university located in Radnor Township, a
suburb northwest of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in the United States. Named for
Saint Thomas of Villanova, the school is the oldest Catholic university in the
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

Founded in 1842 by the Order of Saint Augustine, the university traces its roots
to old Saint Augustine's Church, Philadelphia, which the Augustinian friars
founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, which was
established in 1811. U.S. News and World Report lists Villanova as a "more
selective" regional university and ranks it 1st in this category.
